alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 3:38PM AKST until December 27 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST TUESDAY FROM ANCHOR POINT NORTH... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations of a light glaze up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula from Anchor Point north. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of very light freezing rain and/or drizzle are possible through this afternoon. However, areas of steadier freezing rain are expected to develop by early evening and continue into late tonight or early Tuesday morning. Freezing rain is then expected to transition back to snow and linger across the area through the day Tuesday with 1 to 3 inches of snow possible by Tuesday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
